properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 10 at 10:48PM EST until February 13 at 6:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers
in North Carolina...

French Broad River At Blantyre affecting Henderson and Transylvania
Counties.

Forecasted rainfall of 2-4 inches across the Upper French Broad River
will occur over saturated soils through early Tuesday afternoon.
French Broad River levels are still elevated following heavy rainfall
late last week, therefore, the forecasted rainfall will cause yet
another round of significant rises along the French Broad River.
Minor flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to the river are expected
to begin on Tuesday and may persist through Thursday.  More significant
river rises are possible so concerned residents are encouraged to
follow the latest forecasts and product updates for the latest
information.

The Flood Warning continues for
The French Broad River At Blantyre.
* from Tuesday afternoon to Thursday morning.
* At 10:30 PM Monday the stage was 12.8 feet and rising steadily.
* Minor Flood Stage is 16.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* FORECAST: The river will rise above Minor Flood Stage by Tuesday
afternoon and continue to rise to near 17.0 feet by early Wednesday
morning.the river will fall below Minor Flood Stage by Wednesday
evening.
* IMPACT: At 17.0 feet...Minor Flooding continues.  Floodwaters
continue to inundate farmland between the French Broad River and
the railroad tracks. Floodwaters may start to inundate the
shoulders of River Road near the Big Willow Road intersection.
Floodwaters continue to impact boat access areas at Grove Bridge
Rd. and Crab Creek Rd.
* IMPACT: At 15.0 feet...Action/Advisory Stage.  Most farm fields are
flooding between the French Broad River and Brevard Rd. and between
the French Broad River and Pleasant Grove Rd.
properties.instruction:
The latest stages and forecasts for rivers can be found on our web
page at http://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp
